Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Append FAQ address to AAD unmanaged tenant authentication error" (#7993) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Appending a FAQ link to the AAD authentication error when user account is in an unmanaged tenant state. Also added aka.ms to support this.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7544

Resultant error message on page (this change adds the last sentence):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/81895786-6eb3ec00-95f6-11ea-800f-ae59d949c427.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Force 3 significant figures in Y axis values" (#7990) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Use adjusted rounding and formatting to get the required significant figures. Added logic to append trailing zeroes for visual alignment.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7972

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/81654992-4783e000-9479-11ea-8fe7-e80315b6589b.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "ListPackages (default packages action) now responds to delete requests with a 405" (#7985) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/nuget/engineering/issues/2866

The default action for packages is method agnostic and can be scoped to Get to fix this.

Now returning a 405 for Http deletes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How did you get the PackageVersion?" (#9560) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

https://github.com/kerryjiang/SuperSocket/runs/669537495?check_suite_focus=true
The version "2.0.0-preview3(a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2)" you get is used as production version. How could it become a package version? I suppose you will get the file version as the package version which is "2.0.0-preview3".

The version was defined in https://github.com/kerryjiang/SuperSocket/blob/a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2/Directory.Build.props.
I can modify the format of production version to "2.0.0-preview3-a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2", then the pack procedure will complete successfully.
I would like to know if it is possible keep the previous production version, and **get package version from file version** instead of production version.

/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.201/Sdks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/build/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(77,5): error MSB4018: The "GetPackOutputItemsTask" task failed unexpectedly. [/home/runner/work/SuperSocket/SuperSocket/src/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server.csproj]
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.201/Sdks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/build/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(77,5): error MSB4018: System.ArgumentException: **PackageVersion string specified '2.0.0-preview3(a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2)' is invalid**. [/home/runner/work/SuperSocket/SuperSocket/src/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server.csproj]

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!
https://github.com/kerryjiang/SuperSocket/commit/a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update the editor config, do not separate usings directives" (#9558) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "dotnet pack doesn't find assembly dll if windows locale is non US" (#9561) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/sdk#11442**
- Please respond to @milung.

---

_From @milung on Monday, April 27, 2020 11:19:33 AM_

Generating nuget package does not work on my windows 10 system witn .NET Core SDK 3.1.201 if the system regional settings is the local one (Slovak for region settings) In the such case, I am getting error: 

```
$ dotnet pack
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.201\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): error NU5019: File not found
```

After changing to US regional settings in windows settings and restarting powershell session, the result is as expected. Changing back to the slovak regional settings leads to the same error. 

Similar issue when running dotnet nuget publish - in this case the package file cannot be found. 

**Reproducing:** 

- os Win10, with slovak for the regional setting
- create project with `dotnet new classlib`
- add package name /author into the csproj
- have regional settings in non US (Slovak)
- run dotnet pack

**Workaround**

Set the regional setting to English(USA) in windows 10

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How did you get the PackageVersion?" (#9560) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

https://github.com/kerryjiang/SuperSocket/runs/669537495?check_suite_focus=true
The version "2.0.0-preview3(a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2)" you get is used as production version. How could it become a package version? I suppose you will get the file version as the package version which is "2.0.0-preview3".

The version was defined in https://github.com/kerryjiang/SuperSocket/blob/a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2/Directory.Build.props.
I can modify the format of production version to "2.0.0-preview3-a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2", then the pack procedure will complete successfully.
I would like to know if it is possible keep the previous production version, and **get package version from file version** instead of production version.

/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.201/Sdks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/build/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(77,5): error MSB4018: The "GetPackOutputItemsTask" task failed unexpectedly. [/home/runner/work/SuperSocket/SuperSocket/src/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server/SuperSocket.WebSocket.Server.csproj]
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.201/Sdks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack/build/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(77,5): error MSB4018: System.ArgumentException: PackageVersion string specified '2.0.0-preview3(a0348157292533798b77690ab683d2e06f7fa1b2)' is invalid. Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash][Test Failure] The “Browse” tab is not aligned left with search box" (#9559) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
VS Version: Master\30112.146
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5.
NuGet Version: Dev\5.7.0.6611
## Installiation
Install VS: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3723092&view=ms.vss-build-web.run-extensions-tab
## Repro steps
1.  Launch Visual Studio 2019 preview.
2. Click “Create a New Project” button and create a new Console App (.Net Core) project.
3. Observe the position of “Browse” tab. 
## Expected
The “Browse” tab should be aligned left with search box.
## Actual
The “Browse” tab is not be aligned left with search box.
![NotLeftAligned](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/81796716-68633880-9540-11ea-99e5-a04c4b4a292d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
